alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 9:13AM EDT until May 27 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Mecklenburg County in south central Virginia... Western Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... * Until 1000 AM EDT. * At 912 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Alton to 6 miles south of Virgilina to 7 miles southwest of Oxford, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Buffalo Springs around 935 AM EDT. Clarksville around 940 AM EDT. Chase City, Boydton and Kells Corner around 1000 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Nelson, Wilburn, Spanish Grove, Loves Mill, Arvins Store, John H Kerr Dam, Finchley, Nutbush, Finneywood and Skipwith. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for south central Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for south central Virginia.
